content: Please select the product you have encountered the problem with.

connections.title: Trezor device
connections.description: Our main product. The hardware wallet for storing the supported cryptocurrencies and offers even more.

connections.title: Cryptosteel
connections.description: A handy steel  container for safe storage of your recovery seed. Never store your seed digitally!

content: Please select appropriate category related to your problem.

connections.title: Hardware issue
connections.description:
Visible defects and errors (U2F) directly on your Trezor device and similar issues.
Example: Device not powering up, damaged display, U2F errors etc.

connections.title: Interface issue
connections.description:
An issue occurred while using the official software or other compatible third-party software.
Example: Device is not detected by the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io, beta-wallet.trezor.io), accounts are not loading, incorrect balance etc.

content:
If you do not know how to use your Cryptosteel, please visit our wiki for more information. 

In case your Cryptosteel was delivered damaged or it has some physical defect, please continue further.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Click "Next" to continue to the contact form.

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).
Please select the corresponding issue.

connections.title: Device not working
connections.description: Trezor device screen is not lit up and it is not detected by the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io, beta-wallet.trezor.io).

connections.title: Physical damage
connections.description:
There are clearly visible physical defects on the Trezor device.
Example: Broken screen, damaged case, ports etc.

connections.title: U2F problems
connections.description: You see an error message on the Trezor device screen regarding U2F.

content:
What interface/service are you using with your Trezor device?

The list of official software/services can be found here.

The list of compatible 3rd party software/services can be found here.

connections.title: Official
connections.description: The Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io, beta-wallet.trezor.io), TPM etc

connections.title: 3rd party
connections.description: Electrum, Mycelium, MyEtherWallet and others

content:
Please try to use your Trezor device with several different USB cables (it is always better to use multiple cables to make sure that something important was not overlooked).

Make sure the cables are for transferring data, not only for charging purposes. 

The USB cable that was successfully used for transferring data with another device is the best candidate for this test. 

Please avoid using USB hubs, USB adapters or USB reductions as well.
metadata: dead, power, turning up, not working, bricked

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it did not help, continue further by clicking on "Next".

content: Please specify the nature of the damage.

connections.title: Display problem
connections.description: Bad pixels or non-functional Trezor device screen.

connections.title: Button problem
connections.description: Stuck or non-functional button(s). Only for Trezor One Model since Trezor Model T has no buttons, but the touchscreen.

connections.title: Micro USB port problem
connections.description: Damaged micro USB port.

content: Could you please confirm that you saw the error message  ”Another U2F device was used to register in this application.” Only when you were trying to use your Trezor device as a U2F token with a web service?

connections.title: Yes, I was trying to use Trezor as a U2F token
No, the error message was there without me trying to log into any web service

content:
The message ”Another U2F device was used to register in this application” (popisující obrázek) visible on your Trezor device screen/touchscreen, means that your computer is trying to use the U2F feature with some web service, but:

  1. Your Trezor device was not registered with that web service
  2. You wiped your Trezor device and used a different recovery seed

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Click on "Next" to continue to the possible solution.

content:
1. Please verify whether you registered your Trezor device as a U2F token with the respective web service and that there are no issues with the registration
  2. In case you have more than one Trezor device with the same recovery seed and then registered one of them as U2F token, please try to use that particular Trezor device. Generally, because of the U2F mechanics, it is better to use the same device that you used for the registration (even though your other device uses the same recovery seed).

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still no progress? Please click to continue to the next suggestion.

content:
Please try the recovery procedure with your Trezor. 

Never start the recovery procedure without making sure that your recovery seed is available and written down correctly. 

To verify if your recovery seed is correct, please use the dry-run feature.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Some problems may be complicated. If your issue is not resolved, please click on "Next" to continue to contact form.

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

The problem is usually caused by some application that sends U2F requests everywhere or a web with a faulty login form. 

We have had reports that there were some problems with Etherdelta, Metamask and Ledger (because of their broken implementation of U2F protocol), for example.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Click on "Next" to continue to the possible solution.

content:
1. Please check whether on your computer are installed extensions related to Etherdelta, Metamask or Ledger and uninstall/disable them. This should be certainly your first step.
  2. Since the issue is probably related to your configuration, we would suggest clearing the cache of your browser or completely uninstalling and then reinstalling it.

Here are some links describing how to clear the cache of your browser:

Chrome - https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/32050?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en

Firefox - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-clear-firefox-cache

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Some problems may be complicated. If your issue is not resolved, please click on "Next" to continue to contact form.

content:
Please try your Trezor device with a different computer. If everything is working with the different computer, then the problem is in your actual configuration (faulty USB ports or something else) and unfortunately, there is nothing that can be done from our side as the only possible solution is to perform the repair or use different computer/configuration. 

Checking this option is recommended.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still no progress? Please, go to the next step.

content: Please let us know with that Trezor Model you're experiencing your issues.

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

In case you purchased the product from one of our resellers (not from our official e-shop at shop.trezor.io), please contact them directly as all RMA procedures are handled by the resellers.

The purpose of the RMA procedure is to report a faulty product so that you can claim a replacement, not to claim back your money. The return window for RMA is, therefore, based on warranty conditions of the product.

content: Please select the operating system you're using with Trezor.

Please try to use your device with several different USB cables (it is always better to use multiple cables to make sure that something important was not overlooked).

Make sure the cables are for transferring data, not only for charging purposes. 

The USB cable that was successfully used for transferring data with another device is the best candidate for this test. 

Please avoid using USB hubs, USB adapters or USB reductions as well.

content: Did you perform the firmware update before this problem occurred?

Please check whether you see the Trezor device in the list of USB devices after typing and executing this command in the terminal (command line): ioreg -p IOUSB

You can find more details regarding the terminal (command line) here.

connections.title: Yes, I see a Trezor reference on the list
connections.description: přidá tag (viděl)

connections.title: No, I did not see any Trezor reference on the list
connections.description: přidá tag (neviděl)

content: Please verify if you have correctly installed UDEV rules. Click here for more details.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Didn't help? Please click on "Next" to continue to the next advice.

content:
Windows sometimes regards Trezor as a new device after the firmware procedure and the drivers do not update automatically.

The driver is provided by Windows itself as Trezor is the standard USB device. There is no specific driver to download.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Click on "Next" to continue to the possible solution

content:
Please try to use your device with several different USB cables (it is always better to use multiple cables to make sure that something important was not overlooked).

Make sure the cables are for transferring data, not only for charging purposes. 

The USB cable that was successfully used for transferring data with another device is the best candidate for this test. 

Please avoid using USB hubs, USB adapters or USB reductions as well.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it did not help, continue further by clicking on "Next".

content: Please open the “Device Manager” (click here to show the details how to do it) while your Trezor device is plugged into the computer, search for the unrecognized driver (icon with a yellow triangle with "!" mark inside), click on the item with the right mouse button and choose "update drivers".

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to see more tips how to locate the unrecognized driver.

text: Tips how to locate/update the needed driver
content:
1. The necessary driver can be usually found in "Universal Serial Bus controllers" section, under the name "USB composite device". In other cases, you can also find the necessary driver in "Human Interface devices". 
  2. If you are not sure which driver to update, you can try to unplug and plug in your Trezor again, to see if there are some changes in the current section of the "Device Manager". Deleting the needed driver can also do the trick, as the system will update the driver automatically after you restart the computer.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Didn't help? Please click on "Next" to continue to the next advice.

content:
Please try to use your device with several different USB cables (it is always better to use multiple cables to make sure that something important was not overlooked).

Make sure the cables are for transferring data, not only for charging purposes. 

The USB cable that was successfully used for transferring data with another device is the best candidate for this test. 

Please avoid using USB hubs, USB adapters or USB reductions as well.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue further.

content:
Please try to use your device with several different USB cables (it is always better to use multiple cables to make sure that something important was not overlooked).

Make sure the cables are for transferring data, not only for charging purposes. 

The USB cable that was successfully used for transferring data with another device is the best candidate for this test. 

Please avoid using USB hubs, USB adapters or USB reductions as well.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue further.

content:
What method are you using for communication between your Trezor device and your computer?

There are two methods: WebUSB (Google Chrome browser only) and Trezor Bridge (Google Chrome and Firefox browser).

Please try your Trezor device with a different computer. If everything is working with the different computer, then the problem is in your actual configuration (faulty USB ports or something else) and unfortunately, there is nothing that can be done from our side as the only possible solution is to perform the repair or use different computer/configuration. 

Checking this option is recommended.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Some problems may be complicated. If your issue is not resolved, please click on "Next" to continue to contact form.

content: How did you purchase the product?

connections.title: Official trezor e-shop
connections.description: The product was purchased from shop.trezor.io.

connections.title: Reseller
connections.description: The product was purchased from a different source than shop.trezor.io.

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

In case you purchased the product from one of our resellers (not from our official e-shop at shop.trezor.io), please contact them directly as all RMA procedures are handled by the resellers.

The purpose of the RMA procedure is to report a faulty product so that you can claim a replacement, not to claim back your money. The return window for RMA is, therefore, based on warranty conditions of the product.
We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Please make sure that you're using Google Chrome browser that can use WebUSB connection. The latest versions of the browser are recommended.

If you're not able to use WebUSB, then we will suggest to use Trezor Bridge instead. 

The link for downloading Trezor bridge can be found here (select the appropriate version based on your operating system and please don't click on "PGP signature", it will not download the needed file).

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If you have problems even with Trezor Bridge, please click on "Next".

content:
Please check whether “trezord” (https://wiki.trezor.io/Trezor_Bridge)  process is running on your system via Task Manager or Activity Monitor (based on your operating system). Here is general information regarding Task Managers (Activity Monitors).

The above mentioned “trezord” process is necessary for the communication between your Trezor device and the computer. 

Some antiviruses, firewalls, add-ons (especially Privacy Badger or Ghostery) or VPN programs could block this process, causing Trezor to be unrecognized by your computer. Please verify those possibilities by turning off or changing the privacy settings in the respective software.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still no progress? Please click on "Next" to continue further.

content: As the first troubleshooting step, please try to use your Trezor device with Beta Wallet Interface (beta-wallet.trezor.io).

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Not helping? Then please go to the next step.

content: Please select the type of your issue.

connections.title: I see the  “Wrong PIN entered” error message
I cannot access my accounts after using the passphrase

content: Please select the type of your issue.

connections.title: There is a Bitcore server error  message
connections.description: Posoudit, Přidat tag “bitcore”

connections.title: The Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io) timed out

content: If it is possible, please try switching to a different cryptocurrency by clicking on (Wallet Settings) Select wallet currency, then on the Save & Reload button and refresh the browser by using the  F5 key on your keyboard.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still no success? Then we will try something else in the next step.

content:
Please clear your browser cache or try to run it in incognito (private) mode. 

Here are some links describing how to clear the cache of your browser.

Chrome - https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/32050?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en

Firefox - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-clear-firefox-cache

Here are some links describing how to use incognito (private) mode - 

Chrome - https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95464?co=GENIE.Platform%3DAndroid&hl=en

Firefox - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/private-browsing-use-firefox-without-history

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please continue further if it did not help.

content: Do you see your Trezor device status as “connected”? The information can be found under the name of your Trezor in the Trezor Wallet interface.

Some antiviruses, firewalls, add-ons (especially Privacy Badger or Ghostery) or VPN programs can interfere with this process.

Please verify those possibilities by turning off or changing the privacy settings in the respective software.

connections.title: Next
connections.image: If it did not help, please go to next step.

content:
Please try your device with several different USB cables (it is always better to use multiple cables to make sure that something important was not overlooked).

Make sure the cables are for transferring data, not only for charging purposes. 

The USB cable that was successfully used for transferring data with another device is the best candidate for this test. 

Please avoid using USB hubs, USB adapters and USB reductions as well.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it did not help, continue further.

content: Please try your device with different computer. The problem may be in your actual configuration (faulty USB ports). Checking this option is recommended.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still not resolved? Please, go to the next step.

text: Basic troubleshooting (too many or big transactions)
content: Is it possible that your accounts holds too many or too large transactions? Do you remember the Trezor Wallet interface warning you about this in the past?

In case you are not able to load your accounts at all, there are a few suggestions how to access them.

Tip1:

Please try to use your Trezor device with Electrum wallet. Here is a guide how to use it with our product - https://blog.trezor.io/using-trezor-with-electrum-v3-a0b9bcffe26e

If you were able to access your accounts, you should optimize them according to the advice included in this article - https://blog.trezor.io/solution-to-slow-loading-optimize-your-accounts-4ab5a00f12fe

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Any progress? Continue to Tip2.

content:
Tip2:

Please proceed only in emergency situations. Providing your recovery seed may compromise the whole security of your wallet and put your funds at risk.

Please try to restore your accounts with the recovery seed (https://wiki.trezor.io/Recovery_seed) directly in Electrum wallet. 

Here is a guide how to do it - link na wiki (musí se nejprve dodělat článek)

If you were able to access your accounts, you should immediately transfer your funds to the new wallet on your Trezor device according to the advice included in this article - https://blog.trezor.io/solution-to-slow-loading-optimize-your-accounts-4ab5a00f12fe

The procedure should be performed with these steps:

1. Wipe your Trezor device (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AWiping+your+Trezor&ModelType=1)

2. Create the new wallet and write down the new recovery seed (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=Getting+started+in+5+steps&ModelType=1) “Create new wallet”

3. Transfer the funds back to the safety of Trezor device (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AReceiving+payments&ModelType=1) and optimize your accounts according to this article - https://blog.trezor.io/solution-to-slow-loading-optimize-your-accounts-4ab5a00f12fe

connections.title: Next
connections.description: The problem still not resolved? Please continue to the contacting form.

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

The message “Wrong PIN entered” on your Trezor display means that you are entering an incorrect PIN. Unfortunately, there is no other explanation for this situation.

Please take a look at the following link where it is explained how PIN matrix works - https://wiki.trezor.io/User_manual:Entering_your_PIN

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If this did not help, please go to the next step.

content:
If you have the correct recovery seed (https://wiki.trezor.io/Recovery_seed), you do not need to worry. There is a way how to set a new PIN by wiping your Trezor device. Your Trezor device will be also wiped after the 16th failed attempt of entering the PIN.

If you have already some funds stored there, you can restore your whole wallet with the corresponding recovery seed.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: In case you do not know how to wipe or recover your Trezor device, continue further.

content:
1) Visit wallet.trezor.io

2) When the PIN window shows up, click on X button to close the window

3) You will now enter your wallet

4) Click on the name of your Trezor (My Trezor by default)

4) Now proceed to 'Advanced' tab

5) Select the option “Check recovery seed” and perform it with your seed

6) Continue with  “Wipe Your Device” button on the bottom page in bright red color (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AWiping+your+Trezor&ModelType=1)

6) Confirm action on your Trezor to wipe your device.

7) Unplug and plug in your Trezor.

Now you will see two options in your wallet.

If you had some coins on your Trezor, select an option “Recover wallet” - you will be asked to enter your seed in random order, please follow the instruction on your Trezor.

If you had no coins on your Trezor, select the option “Create a new wallet” - you will have new seed generated.

In case you have problems with the recovery, please go to the next step.

1. Please check your internet connection (whether the other webpages are working).

2. Please check whether your firewall, antivirus or VPN is not blocking Trezor Wallet interface (linky na wallety).

3. You can check the functionality of our servers via this link (http://status.trezor.io/). If a server is down, our team is already working on fixing this issue. Thank you for your patience.

Please try your Trezor device with a different computer. If everything is working with the different computer, then the problem is in your actual configuration (faulty USB ports or something else) and unfortunately, there is nothing that can be done from our side as the only possible solution is to perform the repair or use different computer/configuration. 

Checking this option is recommended.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still no progress? Please, go to the next step.

content: How did you purchase the product?

connections.title: Official trezor e-shop
connections.description: The product was purchased from shop.trezor.io

connections.title: Reseller
connections.description: The product was purchased from other source than shop.trezor.io

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

In case you purchased the product from one of our resellers (not from our official e-shop at shop.trezor.io), please contact them directly as all RMA procedures are handled by the resellers.

The purpose of the RMA procedure is to report a faulty product so that you can claim a replacement, not to claim back your money. The return window for RMA is, therefore, based on warranty conditions of the product.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If the reseller refuses to start the RMA procedure, please continue further by clicking on "Next".

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Please check if you are connected to your Dropbox account. Popisující obrázek

If you have more accounts, please try switching between them when connecting to the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io).

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Any progress? Continue further.

content:
Please try these instructions to set the homescreen (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AHomescreen&ModelType=1)

You can create your own homescreen with this editor.

To upload your custom homescreen, it has to be in the required format (128 x 64 px; black & white only).

Please clear your browser cache or try to run it in incognito (private) mode. 

Here are some links describing how to clear the cache of your browser.

Chrome - https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/32050?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en

Firefox - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-clear-firefox-cache

Here are some links describing how to use incognito (private) mode - 

Chrome - https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95464?co=GENIE.Platform%3DAndroid&hl=en

Firefox - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/private-browsing-use-firefox-without-history

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it did not help. please continue further.

content:
Please check if your Dropbox account is not full (https://www.dropbox.com/help/space/account-space-left) and the mtdt file in the Dropbox folder "/Apps/Trezor/" is not missing or overwritten with an empty file.

If yes, try to restoring your Dropbox account (https://www.dropbox.com/deleted_files). For more information, contact Dropbox support (https://www.dropbox.com/contact).

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it did not solve your problem, please go to the next step.

content:
Since the labeling is tied to the respective setup/recovery seed (https://wiki.trezor.io/Recovery_seed), the information from labeling will not be visible when you wiped the device and proceed with a new setup.

You can try to use the original recovery seed where you’ve set the labeling in recovery process.

Before you start the recovery procedure, please make sure that your current wallet and funds on it are backed up with your recovery seed via dry-run feature(https://blog.trezor.io/test-your-seed-backup-dry-run-recovery-df9f2e9889)!!!

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If the problem is still not resolved, please continue to the final step.

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).
We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Every processed transaction and every transaction waiting for confirmation can be found on the blockchain of the respective cryptocurrency.

Example: The Bitcoin transactions, can be seen with this block explorer. (https://www.blockchain.com/explorer). 

There should be several block explorers for each respective cryptocurrency.

Please take a look at the respective blockchain to verify the status of your transaction.

connections.title: Confirmed transaction
connections.description: Your transaction is confirmed on the blockchain.

connections.title: Unconfirmed transaction
connections.description: Your transaction is unconfirmed on the blockchain.

connections.title: Not visible on blockchain
connections.description: You cannot see your transaction on the blockchain at all.

connections.title: Crosschain transaction
connections.description:
You sent a different coin type to a different blockchain.
Some cryptocurrencies are using the same address formats.

content:
Firstly, we are really sorry for such an unfortunate situation.

In case you see some sent transactions which you did not confirm, there are only two possible attack vectors.

1. Your seed was compromised (https://wiki.trezor.io/Recovery_seed) - Your recovery seed is the only way how to restore your whole wallet (balance, accounts etc). If the attacker gets to your recovery seed, he or she can clone your wallet and operate with all your  funds not protected by the passphrase (https://wiki.trezor.io/Passphrase).

This may happen when you keep your recovery seed digitally (on your computer, mobile device, USB drive etc) or when you provide  the recovery seed to a  third-party service (especially when you want to claim some forks) or when your recovery seed was stolen (someone else has physical access to it).

Please note that we cannot  track the person who used your recovery seed or when and how it was compromised, because it is not leaving any trackable information.

2. Someone knows your PIN (potentially  even your passphrase) (https://wiki.trezor.io/PIN) - If somebody knows your sensitive data like PIN or passphrase and has physical access to your Trezor device,  he or she can freely manipulate with the balance stored there. 

We would suggest to check who had the possibility to manipulate with your Trezor device and keep it as an evidence (for fingerprints for example).

Conclusion

Overall, the two presented scenarios are the only explanation for your situation. There is no evidence that Trezor was ever actually hacked and we recommend to start the investigation with the police according to the  facts suggested in this text.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If you need to clarify some aspects or you have  questions directly from the police that need to be answered, please continue further, we will provide full assistance in this matter.

content: Are you experiencing problems after confirming to send the transaction (timed out, stuck browser)?

It is important to keep in mind that the Trezor hardware wallet is only responsible for signing transactions when being sent from the device. It is not responsible for confirming the transaction on the respective network. 

Please select who was the receiver of this transaction. Poznámka aby si uživatel uložil link na tx, pro případnou další komunikaci

connections.title: I have sent it to my Trezor
I have sent it to a different source than my Trezor

content:
If you provided a lower fee, it may take some time until the transaction is included in the next block (confirmed by the respective network). In some cases, when the fee is very low, the transaction might not be processed at all and will return to its source after some time.

It is important to keep in mind that the Trezor hardware wallet is only responsible for signing transactions when being sent from the device. It is not responsible for confirming the transaction on the respective network.

connections.title: The transaction disappeared from the Trezor Wallet interface
How long until the transaction is confirmed or returned?

content:
In this case, the transaction was probably not sent or processed at all by the respective network (blockchain) and your balance should be the same. Transactions not processed by the network are returned after some time.

Please take a look at these instructions about how to create a transaction (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AMaking+payments&ModelType=1).

It is important to keep in mind that the Trezor hardware wallet is only responsible for signing transactions when being sent from the device. It is not responsible for confirming the transaction on the respective network.

connections.title: My account balance is not correct
How long until the transaction is returned?
The funds were sent to a different network (blockchain)

content:
Some cryptocurrencies are unfortunately using the same address formats. The developers of the respective cryptocurrencies are responsible for introducing their products without confusing the users and distinguishing the addresses properly.

If you are one of these victims, you can try our recovery tool (https://trezor.io/recover-coins/).

Please note that only certain scenarios can be resolved and the receiver needs to be your Trezor device account. 

More details about how to operate with the claiming tool can be found here - https://blog.trezor.io/recover-coins-guide-bitcoin-litecoin-78da0d290c79

text: Transaction was sent to my Trezor
content:
Did you verify your generated receiving address with “Show full address” function

(https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AReceiving+payments&ModelType=1)? Upravit

text: Transaction was sent to different source than my Trezor
content:
There may be some scenarios in such case.

1. The transaction was sent to someone else and that person claims that he or she did not receive anything, but the transaction is clearly confirmed by the respective blockchain (network). In this case we would suggest to verify the address provided by that person. It is possible that you were provided with a wrong address or that you mistyped the address when sending funds.

Comparing both addresses ( the one provided and the one on blockchain) is the key.

Note that some address formats are also case sensitive.

2. If the transaction was sent to some exchange account or a third-party wallet, you will need to contact the support of the respective service. Some suggestions presented in the previous point may be helpful when communicating with their support.

Please keep in mind that nobody can revert confirmed transactions. There is freedom in using cryptocurrencies. However, the freedom entails that you are the sole person responsible for your funds. It is, therefore, necessary to check carefully where you send your funds. Remember, you are your own bank.

We are sorry, but there is nothing more we can do in a situation like this.
Do you see your Trezor device status as “connected”? The information can be found under the name of your Trezor in the Trezor Wallet interface.
Do you use passphrase (https://blog.trezor.io/hide-your-trezor-wallets-with-multiple-passphrases-f2e0834026eb) protection?

If you generated the receiving address under a passphrase, please make sure you are typing the correct one.

The passphrase is case sensitive, it can contain any ASCII characters and its length can be up to 50 characters.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: In case it did not solve your problem, please continue further.

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).
We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Comparing the generated address for receiving your funds that is shown on your computer with the address shown on Trezor device screen, is one of the crucial aspects to make sure that this address is not changed by some malicious software like a specialized malware.

That is why it is set “Show full address” as a default option when generating the new addresses.

More details can be found here - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AReceiving+payments&ModelType=1

We would suggest comparing all the addresses you can see in your receive tab with the destination address shown on blockchain where your funds ended.

Is the address matching the address generated by the Trezor device?

If you could not find the funds in the address in the Receive tab, it could be caused by these possible scenarios:

1. You have mistyped the destination address when sending the funds.

2. There is some malicious software, like specialized malware, that changed the destination address - we strongly suggest to run some antivirus tests on your computer.

Unfortunately, in both of the presented scenarios, the funds are lost and cannot be reverted unless you know the person who owns the addresses where the funds were sent.

3. The passphrase protection was used.

connections.title: I do not use passphrase protection

content:
When there is a large number of unconfirmed transactions in the respective network, it is possible that not all of them will fit into the memory of the nodes immediately. It is an inherent technical limitation of Bitcoin and some other cryptocurrencies.

For instance, the transaction can get temporarily "lost" on its way to some node (it generally happens to low-fee transactions) and, therefore, it will not propagate to our servers. Hence, the unconfirmed transaction can be visible for a while, but then disappears from the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io).

If a transaction disappears from the Trezor Wallet interface after a longer time of not being confirmed, it might mean that it was canceled due to a low fee.

Once the transaction is confirmed by the network, its status will update in the Trezor Wallet interface.

text: The time limit for confirming/returning the transaction
content:
It depends on the rules for the respective network (blockchain) for the particular cryptocurrency and how big is the mempool (https://wiki.trezor.io/Mempool) of unconfirmed transactions in this network.

Example: There may be some tools that will let you know what is the status of the mempool, such as this one - https://jochen-hoenicke.de/queue/#1,24h

In short, the transactions wait in the mempool to be “picked up” by miners. When the network is overwhelmed, the miners will prioritize the transactions with higher fees.

In such situations, the transaction can be confirmed and included into the next block or canceled by the network.

Example: It may take up to 14 days until the transaction is deemed as invalid by the Bitcoin network (other cryptocurrencies may have a different rules).
We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Description of the problem:

You are probably trying to sent too many microtransactions at once and Trezor device has problems verifying all the inputs it contains.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue to possible solution.

content:
Description of the problem:

The reasons why you cannot create the transaction could be a wrong address type to which you are trying to send your funds.

Please make sure you are operating in the correct wallet and that you are trying to use the address format that is available for the current wallet.

It can be also caused by an extra space in the copied address. Please copy only the address.

text: Unable to create a transaction (possible solution)
content:
Possible solution:

Please divide your transaction into smaller parts, until Trezor device is able to send your transaction.

It is also good to take a look at this article, to optimize your accounts and prevent such problems in the future - https://blog.trezor.io/solution-to-slow-loading-optimize-your-accounts-4ab5a00f12fe

text: Unable to create a transaction (possible solution)
content:
Possible solution:

Please follow the instructions how to create the transaction - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AMaking+payments&ModelType=1

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If your problem is still not resolved, please continue with another suggestion.

content:
Please check whether you see “Disconnected device” or “Connected device” when your Trezor is plugged in.

This status is always displayed under your Trezor name.
Please test the functionality of the right button on your Trezor device. You can try to change some of your settings to see its functionality.

Please describe the problem by selecting the appropriate category.

Firmware update - (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AUpdating+your+Trezor%27s+firmware&ModelType=1)

Passphrase - (https://blog.trezor.io/hide-your-trezor-wallets-with-multiple-passphrases-f2e0834026eb)

Recovery procedure - (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3ARecovery&ModelType=1) 

Wiping Trezor device - (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AWiping+your+Trezor&ModelType=1)
metadata: zero, empty, no funds, missing, wrong, incorrect

connections.title: It happened right after the firmware update
I have tried the recovery procedure but I still see a wrong balance.

content:
There are only two official claiming tools for Trezor device.

For Bitcoin Cash (https://trezor.io/claim-bch/) 

for Bitcoin Gold (https://trezor.io/claim-btg/)

Both are are hardforks (https://wiki.trezor.io/Hard_fork) of Bitcoin. 

You can claim those cryptocurrencies only if you had some Bitcoin stored on your Trezor device before the hardforks were started (Bitcoin Cash and Bitcoin Gold launched their own blockchain).

For more details please visit these articles: 

Bitcoin Cash - https://blog.trezor.io/claim-bcash-bitcoin-cash-bch-bcc-trezor-wallet-f0a810d5864a

Bitcoin Gold - https://blog.trezor.io/claim-bitcoin-gold-bgold-btg-f66969e7f2c0

It indicates that your Trezor device was wiped during the firmware update process and then you proceed with the new setup. This happens occasionally when something goes wrong with the update procedure or when it is necessary by the nature of the update. That is why we always recommend making sure your recovery seed (https://wiki.trezor.io/Recovery_seed) is available before you start the update procedure.

If you have your recovery seed for your original wallet (where you stored the funds), there is nothing to worry about.

There are two recovery options in the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io): 

Standard recovery - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3ARecovery&ModelType=1

Advanced recovery - https://wiki.trezor.io/User_manual:Advanced_Recovery

connections.title: I have experienced a recovery error
I have tried the recovery procedure but I still see a wrong balance

content:
The passphrase is a great way  to protect your funds with additional layer of security, but it is necessary to know its mechanics before you start  to use it.

Each passphrase creates a different wallet. 

Therefore, it is necessary to type the same passphrase you used for storing your funds.

The passphrase is case sensitive, it can contain any ASCII characters and its length can be up to 50 characters.

Please  check whether the passphrase is enabled. Popisný obrázek (video/gif)

Leaving the passphrase field blank (not entering any characters and simply hitting “Enter”) reveals your standard wallet.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still not resolved? Please continue further.

content:
If you have performed the recovery and still see the wrong balance then it can mean two things:

1. You did not use the correct recovery seed where your funds were stored. Please make sure that you are using the right seed.

It is also possible that you have mistyped some of the seed words. Please check your seed words with this list (https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/english.txt), where all words are presented. We would suggest searching for words that could be easily confused..

Here are also some suggestions - https://wiki.trezor.io/Commonly_misspelled_words_of_recovery_seed

Your seed cannot be changed once generated, it can only be incorrectly written down.

2. You are using the passphrase protection and your funds were protected by the passphrase wallet. 

The solution in this case is to enable passphrase and type the correct passphrase where you transferred your funds. 

For more details regarding the passphrase, use these links: (https://blog.trezor.io/hide-your-trezor-wallets-with-multiple-passphrases-f2e0834026eb)

Please also check whether the passphrase is enabled. Popisný obrázek (video/gif)

Leaving passphrase field blank (not entering any characters and simply hitting “Enter”) will reveal your standard wallet.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still not resolved? Please continue further.

content:
In case you wiped your Trezor device and want to access your wiped wallet again, there is no need to worry as long as you have your recovery seed for the wallet in question.

There are two recovery options in the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io): 

Standard recovery - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3ARecovery&ModelType=1

Advanced recovery - https://wiki.trezor.io/User_manual:Advanced_Recovery

connections.title: I have tried the recovery procedure but I still see incorrect balance

content:
If you do not have a full backup of the recovery seed, you should not use your Trezor device

https://wiki.trezor.io/Recovery_seed_backup_fail

There are basically two scenarios:

1.You have no coins/passwords stored on this Trezor device - you can wipe it (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AWiping+your+Trezor&ModelType=1) and start the new setup (https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=Getting+started+in+5+steps&ModelType=1#Create_a_new_wallet) with writing new and complete set of recovery seed. 

2.You have coins stored on this Trezor device - please follow the instructions from this article (https://wiki.trezor.io/User_manual:Emergency_situations#You_have_one_Trezor_device_and_recovery_seed_IS_NOT_available)
Please let us know what error message you see on Trezor device screen.
What problem do you need to be resolved?

connections.title: I want to reinstall the Bridge software
The website for download is not available

content:
Description of the problem:

The "Unofficial firmware detected" message usually points out that there was some problem with the update or that you are about to use unofficial firmware, which is surely not recommended.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue to the possible solution.

content:
Description of the problem:

The "Broken firmware" message usually points out that there was some problem with the update.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue to the possible solution.

content:
Possible solution:

Please try to repeat the update procedure from the Trezor Wallet interface(wallet.trezor.io) until the official firmware is successfully installed.

Important:

If you already have some coins or passwords stored on your Trezor device, please verify if you have the correct recovery seed with the dry-run feature (https://blog.trezor.io/test-your-seed-backup-dry-run-recovery-df9f2e9889) before starting the update procedure.

Here is the link for more details regarding how to start the firmware update - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AUpdating+your+Trezor%27s+firmware&ModelType=1

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If the error message appears even after multiple attempts to update the firmware, please continue to the next step.

content:
Please try to use your device with several different USB cables (it is always better to use multiple cables to make sure that something important was not overlooked).

Make sure the cables are for transferring data, not only for charging purposes. 

The USB cable that was successfully used for transferring data with another device is the best candidate for this test. 

Please avoid using USB hubs, USB adapters or USB reductions as well.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it didn’t help, continue further.

content:
Please try your Trezor device with a different computer. If everything is working with the different computer, then the problem is in your actual configuration (faulty USB ports or something else) and unfortunately, there is nothing that can be done from our side as the only possible solution is to perform the repair or use different computer/configuration. 

Checking this option is recommended.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Not resolved? Please continue to the next step.

connections.title: Official Trezor e-shop
connections.description: The product was purchased from shop.trezor.io

connections.title: Reseller
connections.description: The product was purchased from other source than shop.trezor.io

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

In case you purchased the product from one of our resellers (not from our official e-shop at shop.trezor.io), please contact them directly as all RMA procedures are handled by the resellers.

The purpose of the RMA procedure is to report a faulty product so that you can claim a replacement, not to claim back your money. The return window for RMA is, therefore, based on warranty conditions of the product.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If the reseller refuses to start the RMA procedure, please continue further.

text: RMA reseller Firmware update errors form
content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Possible solution:

Please try to repeat the update procedure in the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io) until the official firmware is successfully installed.

Important:

If you already have some coins or passwords stored on your Trezor device, please verify if you have the correct recovery seed with the dry-run feature (https://blog.trezor.io/test-your-seed-backup-dry-run-recovery-df9f2e9889) before starting the update procedure.

Here is the link for more details regarding how to start the firmware update - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AUpdating+your+Trezor%27s+firmware&ModelType=1

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If the error message appears even after multiple attempts to update the firmware, please continue to the next step.

content:
If your antivirus (typically Kaspersky or Norton) is reporting our Bridge software as virus or trojan, then it is most likely a false alarm. 

There is no need to worry, as Trezor Bridge downloaded from Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io, beta-wallet.trezor.io) or the official source page (https://wallet.trezor.io/data/bridge/latest/index.html) is safe to use and virus/trojan-free. 

In conclusion, if downloaded from our websites, it is safe to use even when detected as a virus/trojan by your antivirus.

You can help us whitelisting our software by reporting it as false positive to the respective support of the antivirus company.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: There is also a possibility to report to us the antivirus that is labeling our software as trojan or virus with the special contact form.

content:
Description of the problem:

We have encountered reports about this problem from some time ago. It started with the version of OS X 10.8, which have set certain rules that elevated the security level for all non-Apple distributed applications.

Trezor Bridge is surely not a harmful piece of software if you download it from our official website (wallet.trezor.io) or source page (https://wallet.trezor.io/data/bridge/latest/index.html), so you can use it without any worries (you should click on the installer to download the needed software).

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue to the possible solution.

content:
Here are the instructions for reinstalling Trezor Bridge.

For Windows:

1. Download the latest Bridge version from here: https://wallet.trezor.io/data/bridge/latest/index.html

2. Run the Task manager (press CTRL + Shift + Escape)

3. Terminate the trezord.exe process

4. Go to C:\Program Files (x86)\TREZOR Bridge, find the uninstall.exe, hold Shift and right-click on it and choose "Run as administrator"

5. Uninstall the Trezor Bridge

6. Delete all the remaining files (if there are any left)

7. Run the new bridge installation

8. Go to wallet.trezor.io and try if it works

For Mac:

1. Open terminal (http://blog.teamtreehouse.com/introduction-to-the-mac-os-x-command-line), then type - pkill trezord

2. Go to - applications/utilities

3. Remove folder TREZOR Bridge

4. Go to wallet.trezor.io

5. Download the new version of the installer (https://wallet.trezor.io/data/bridge/latest/index.html)

6. Run installer

7. Refresh wallet.trezor.io

text: The website for download is not available (description)
content:
Here is the link for downloading the latest available versions of the Bridge software for the respective operating systems - https://wallet.trezor.io/data/bridge/latest/index.html

Please click on installer or the corresponding deb package (for Linux) to download the needed software.

You can also check the functionality of our servers via this link (http://status.trezor.io/). If some server is down, our team is already working on fixing this issue. Thank you for your patience.
We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Possible solution:

Please update the security settings of your operating system so it is possible to download or use Trezor Bridge.

Here are some instructions about how to allow downloading files from an unidentified developer - https://kb.wisc.edu/page.php?id=25443
What problem do you need to be resolved?

connections.title: Firmware fingerprint
connections.description: Confused with the firmware fingerprint?

content:
The first update (from the bootloader (https://wiki.trezor.io/Bootloader) version 1.3.2) should be processed with clicking on “Install firmware update” when plugging your Trezor device to the computer and visiting Trezor Wallet (wallet.trezor.io).

If there was some problem or interruption during this procedure, please start the update manually by holding both buttons on your Trezor device while plugging it to the computer and continue with the provided instructions on the Trezor screen and in the Trezor Wallet interface.

Here is the link for more details regarding how to start the update - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AUpdating+your+Trezor%27s+firmware&ModelType=1

connections.title: Next
connections.description: In case it is not resolving your update issue, please continue further.

content:
From the bootloader (https://wiki.trezor.io/Bootloader) version 1.3.2, when you plug your Trezor device for the first time, the firmware update is processed by clicking on “Install firmware update” (followed with a text message in the Trezor Wallet interface- wallet.trezor.io), without comparing the fingerprint. 

All following updates need to be executed manually by the customer and in such case, the fingerprint is visible.

Here is the link for more details regarding how to start the update - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AUpdating+your+Trezor%27s+firmware&ModelType=1

The fingerprint is also not case sensitive, so you do not need to worry if there is a difference in lower or upper caps characters.
When manually attempting to update the firmware, do you see on the Trezor device screen Loader 1.3.0 version?

connections.title: Yes
connections.description: Tag: bl130issue

content:
Description of the problem:

There is a small problem with Trezor Bootloader 1.3.0, which prevents the device from being properly recognized if a user holds the device buttons pressed for a longer-than-necessary amount of time. The problem can be resolved by pressing the buttons only for a short amount of time (click) when entering Bootloader mode.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue to possible solution.

content:
Possible solution:

1. Plug micro-USB into Trezor device.

2. Align USB-A to a port on your computer.

3. Plug the USB-A into your computer. At the same time, click both buttons on your Trezor device.

4. The device should boot up in Bootloader mode, and the computer should recognize it.

5. If the computer does not recognize your Trezor device, please try again. Timing is essential.

It should be resolved with a click rather than with holding the buttons down. We have reports that it helps to quickly release the buttons when plugging the USB cable in.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Still no progress? Please go to the next step.

content:
Please try your device with several different USB cables (it is always better to use multiple cables to make sure that something important was not overlooked).

Make sure the cables are for transferring data, not only for charging purposes. 

The USB cable that was successfully used for transferring data with another device is the best candidate for this test. 

Please avoid using USB hubs, USB adapters or USB reductions as well.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it did not help, continue further.

content: Please try your device with a different computer. The problem may be in your actual configuration (faulty USB ports). Checking this option is recommended.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Not resolved? Please, go to the next step.

content: How did you purchase the product?

connections.title: Official Trezor e-shop
connections.description: The product was purchased from shop.trezor.io

connections.title: Reseller
connections.description: The product was purchased from other source than shop.trezor.io

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

In case you purchased the product from one of our resellers (not from our official e-shop at shop.trezor.io), please contact them directly as all RMA procedures are handled by the resellers.

The purpose of the RMA procedure is to report a faulty product so that you can claim a replacement, not to claim back your money. The return window for RMA is, therefore, based on warranty conditions of the product.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If the reseller refuses to start the RMA procedure, please continue further.

text: RMA reseller Cannot update firmware form
content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Description of the problem:

If you see an error message related to the recovery process, it means that you have mistyped a seed word or that it was entered in the wrong order.
metadata: Search slovo podle chybové hlášky u recovery

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue to the information with possible solution.

content:
Description of the problem:

In case you have encountered the error message (The seed is INVALID!), then it means that the seed written on your recovery card is different than the seed that is actually valid in your Trezor device.

In other words, your Trezor device is not backed up and in an emergency situation (lost, non-functional or wiped Trezor after the firmware update), you will not be able to recover your wallet with this recovery seed.
metadata: dryrun, search slovo podle dotyčné chybové hlášky

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue to the information with possible solution.

content:
Possible solution:

Please enter the seed words in the correct order according to the information visible on your Trezor display (you will be asked to enter your seed words in  a shuffled order).

Here is the link for the recovery instructions - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3ARecovery&ModelType=1

There is also a possibility that a seed word has been mistyped, please check your seed words with this list (https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/english.txt) where all possible seed words are presented. We would suggest searching for words that could be easily confused.

This link can be helpful - https://wiki.trezor.io/Commonly_misspelled_words_of_recovery_seed

Conclusion:

If you still see an  error message during or after the recovery procedure, then unfortunately, your recovery seed is not written correctly and even if it pains us a lot, we are not able to help you in this matter.

In every situation, you need to make sure that your seed is written down correctly as it is the only way to restore your wallet.

We suggest using the dry-run feature (https://blog.trezor.io/test-your-seed-backup-dry-run-recovery-df9f2e9889) to prevent such unfortunate situations  in the future.

Possible solution:

In case you have more recovery seeds, please make sure you use the correct one that is installed in your Trezor device.

We strongly suggest transfering all your funds from the Trezor device as described here (https://wiki.trezor.io/User_manual:Emergency_situations#You_have_one_Trezor_device_and_recovery_seed_IS_NOT_available), creating a new seed and then return your funds back to the safety of your Trezor device.
Is Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io) working without problems?
We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

text: TPM wants to create a new database (description)
content:
There are few explanations what could happen.

1. All your entries (passwords) are tied to the respective recovery seed and if you wiped your Trezor device or it was wiped, for example by the firmware update, TPM would want to create a new database of passwords

2. The encrypted file with the entries saved in the service you’re using (Google Drive or Dropbox) was damaged or overwritten. We would suggest checking the capacity of the service where the file is stored.

Google Drive - https://drive.google.com/settings/storage

Dropbox - https://www.dropbox.com/help/space/account-space-left

Please select the appropriate answer.

connections.title: Trezor device was wiped before this issue
My service is at full capacity or the file could have been overwritten

content:
We will try a series of steps that can resolve your problem.

Please try to restart your TPM.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If this did not help, please continue to Tip2.

content:
Please check the version of your TPM (https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/trezor-password-manager/imloifkgjagghnncjkhggdhalmcnfklk

If you use an older version, please download the newest one and disable the older one.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If this did not help, please continue to Tip3.

content:
Please check the storing capacity of the service (Google Drive or Dropbox) you use and make some room if it is full.

Google Drive - https://drive.google.com/settings/storage

Dropbox - https://www.dropbox.com/help/space/account-space-left

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If this did not help, please continue to Tip4..

content:
Please try to connect your Trezor device with a different service (if you are using Google Drive, try Dropbox and vice versa).

More details can be found here - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3APassword+Manager&ModelType=1#Sign_in_with_Google_Drive_or_Dropbox

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Not resolved? Please go to next step.

content: Please try your device also with a different computer to see if  the issue is not specific to your configuration.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Some problems may be complicated. If your issue is not resolved, please click on "Next" to continue to contact form.

content: We are sorry for the inconvenience, please send us a message including the details about the issue and our Support Team will answer in a timely manner (please take a look at our responsivity policy).

Please start the recovery procedure with your original recovery seed (the seed where the entries were saved).

Here can be found instructions for the recovery procedure - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3ARecovery&ModelType=1

If you have some funds stored on your actual setup (Trezor device), please make sure that they are backed up by your recovery seed via dry-run feature (https://blog.trezor.io/test-your-seed-backup-dry-run-recovery-df9f2e9889).

connections.title: I have encountered the recovery or dry-run errors
I have the recovery seed that is actually installed on my Trezor device
connections.description: Nejspíš změnit

text: Checking the file and account restore (suggestion)
content:
1. Please check whether the pswd file from the corresponding service (either Google Drive or Dropbox) 

a) is not missing 

b) or is not overwritten with an empty file.

The pswd file should be located at:

Google Drive - My Drive/Apps/TREZOR Password Manager

Dropbox - Apps/Trezor Password Manager/

2. If the file is missing or overwritten, then please try to restore your account. For more information how to do it, contact the Dropbox (https://www.dropbox.com/contact) or Google support (https://support.google.com/?hl=en)

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If restoring didn’t solve your problem, please go to the next step.

text: Your passwords were not associated with your available seed (conclusion)
content:
In such case we are really sorry, but it seems that you didn’t associate your entries (passwords) with the recovery seed you have available. 

It’s unfortunate, but there is nothing that can be done from our side as it is necessary to have backed up your assets (funds and passwords as well) with the recovery seed.

You can try to return few steps back to verify whether the problem is not in the corrupted file, if you didn’t try it already.
As the first troubleshooting step, please read the information about this application here - https://wiki.trezor.io/index.php?title=User+manual%3AUsing+Trezor+with+Android&ModelType=1

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it did not help, please go to the next step.

content:
This is the old tool for Chrome browser designed only for the basic settings of the Trezor device.

This software is obsolete and should not be used.

Basic information how to operate with python-tools can be found here: https://wiki.trezor.io/Python_tools

If you have encountered problems with the python-tools related to the Trezor device, please forward it here: https://github.com/trezor/python-trezor/issues

text: Trezor device not detected by mobile device (description)
content:
Description of the problem:

If your Trezor device is not detected by your mobile device (Trezor Manager),  please use this tool to verify that your mobile is compatible. Your mobile device needs to have at least Android OS version 3.1 and the USB host feature must be available (https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/connectivity/usb/host).

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on "Next" to continue to the possible solution.

content:
Possible solution:

With this tool (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=eu.chainfire.usbhostdiagnostics&hl=en), you can verify whether your mobile device has this feature available.

Certain mobile devices do have this feature, but it is not enabled by default. Please contact the support of your mobile device manufacturer to receive the necessary instructions.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: In case your problem is not resolved, please continue further.

content:
Please verify if your OTG cable (https://wiki.trezor.io/OTG_cable) is connected correctly. 

The OTG cable should be plugged in with the correct end, so please try switching the sides.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If it did not help, please go to the next step.

content:
Please verify if your OTG cable is not faulty.

You can test it by trying to transfer some data via this cable. If it is not possible, the cable is probably defective.

We recommend trying your Trezor device with a different OTG cable (preferably more cables).

connections.title: Next
connections.description: Please click on next, to show another suggestion if this did not help.

content: Is Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io) working without problems?

This means that your Trezor device is functional and the problem is in your mobile device. 

Please repeat the previous route and suggestions. It is possible that you overlooked some important details.
Please select the corresponding application.

connections.title: MyEtherWallet (MEW)
connections.description:
There are problems with MyEtherWallet and the Trezor device.
https://wiki.trezor.io/Apps:MyEtherWallet

connections.title: Electrum
connections.description:
There are problems with Electrum and the Trezor device. 
https://wiki.trezor.io/Apps:Electrum

connections.title: Mycelium
connections.description:
There are problems with Mycelium and the Trezor device.
https://wiki.trezor.io/Apps:Mycelium

connections.title: Others
connections.description: There are problems with other compatible applications and the Trezor device.

content:
If the service or software that you want to use with your Trezor was not found in the list of compatible third-party products, you need to contact the developers of that product and ask them to start the integration procedure with us.

In case you are a developer yourself, please take a look here (https://github.com/trezor) and start the necessary steps yourself.

If your product is interesting, we will surely provide more assistance.
Does the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io) work without problems?
Does the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io) work without problems?
Does the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io) work without problems?
Does the Trezor Wallet interface (wallet.trezor.io) work without problems?

This indicates that the Trezor device is functional, but the problem is in the third-party compatible software or service. Please contact their respective support, as we are not the developers nor maintainers of their product.
Was the firmware update performed prior to this issue?

connections.title: The issue occurred right after performing the firmware update
The firmware update was not performed right before this issue

content: When you visit the Trezor Wallet interface, did it recognize the device and ask you to enter the PIN?

If you're experiencing flickering of your touchscreen during the operations with your Trezor device, please update your firmware to the version 2.0.10 since it is a software problem that is fixed by this firmware version.

The information how to find your current version of the firmware installed on your Trezor device is included here.

connections.title: Next
connections.description: If you have a different problem or the flickering issue is not fixed by the firmware 2.0.10 version, please click on "Next" to continue further.
